poem:
Title: "Towards the Inevitable"

Iron fists in velvet gloves,
Stoicism wrapped in disdain. 
Why the charade of democracy's game,
When power's hunger sates but never saves?
A one-horse race on frozen tundra plains,
Putin's reign, enduring, never wanes. 
Like the icy Siberian gales,
His governance, never frail;
Yet, beneath the surface runs,
The unsaid question of the lonely suns.
